name: Curry Salmon with Broccoli
author: CANDIE GRAHAM
summary: This is an easy and delicious way to use either fresh or frozen salmon. Being from Alaska, our family puts up with a lot of salmon during the summer. This is a very good recipe to use in the middle of winter when your family is saying no more fish please!
ingredients: 1 ½ cups uncooked long grain white rice
2 (10.75 ounce) cans  condensed cream of celery soup
2 pounds salmon fillets, bones and skin removed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Bring the rice and water to boil in a pot
Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 25 minutes
Arrange broccoli in the bottom of the baking dish
Mix the cream of celery soup, mayonnaise, wine, and curry in a bowl, and pour 1/2 evenly over the broccoli
Cut salmon into chunks and place in baking dish
Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven, until broccoli is tender and fish flakes easily with a fork
